p: Table 2 shows that Model 1 displays the lowest AIC and highest R 2. The adjusted R 2 of Model 1 is 0.86. In addition to this, we found that if we only use MFT ( x 1) as predictor (Model 2), the predictive ability is as good as model 1 (the adjusted R 2 = 0.84). Model 2 performs much better than that of using annual mean temperature ( x 2, adjusted R 2 = 0.51; Model 3), 78th percentile temperature ( x 3, adjusted R 2 = 0.60; Model 4), and latitude ( x 4, adjusted R 2 = 0.28; Model 5), respectively. The coefficients of Model 1 are shown in Supplementary Table 1. From Supplementary Table 1, we can see that the association between MFT and MMT is not changed when gross domestic product [GDP]/capita, latitude and the study year are adjusted. Therefore, to present a simplified model for practical use, we recommend using Model 2 to predict MMT.
